reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is located in a small "shopping gallery", with it's own metro station, you don't even have the chance to get wet between the metro and the reception ;-)
reviews.title: Great location, good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a room on the 3rd floor, kind of suite with small kitchen (microwave, fridge, sink) a living room, a bedroom and a bathroom with bath
reviews.title: Perfectly functional hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything was super clean (I asked for hard floor, no carpet).
reviews.title: Excellent location, very good price
"Nice hotel" - Nice Hotel to stay
reviews.text: Negative points : airco was not functionning and even with -1°c outside we slept with open windows, they are building around the hotel and the builders start working at 7am => a little bit noisy during the week

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Positive points : location, breakfast, shopping area, staff
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great location, overpriced breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well priced hotel, centrally located walking distance to Stephansplatz. The rooms & bathroom are very spacious, if a little sparse. The room I booked had a separate lounge with open-plan kitchen. Staff are helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Great value hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The NH Wein is mostly a business hotel. The hotel seems to be comprised of interconnected renovated old buildings that are now a part of the hotel. Some rooms are new while others are well used.
reviews.title: Great Location, Okay Room

likes.liked: — Modern air conditioned hotel. Nice lobby.
likes.disliked: — Maze of rooms and the access to the rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: We asked for a non-smoking room and got a smoking room, though the smoke smell was minimal. Air conditioning was okay but not exceptional. You can open the windows to the room. Service at the front desk can be good to rather slow and aloof. The room has tub, shower, fridge, microwave, and TV. Room was okay not not exceptional.
reviews.title: Don't expext too much...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The breakfast in the hotel is rather good. Cooked foods including scrambled eggs, hard boiled eggs, sausages, crepes, and bacon. They are also have an abundant alternative of cold foods from cereals to fruits to meats.
reviews.title: Great Hotel For Family

likes.liked: — Its decently new, clean, modern, location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: There is free internet but you must and the front desk for the passcode. The hotel is hard to find but if you are walking from the Neugbeaugasse Station it is really close. When driving you have to use the Lindengasse St to get to the front lobby of the hotel. The location of the hotel for a tourist is excellent. It is litterally connected to the U-bahn station (Neubeaugasse Station, use the Stiffgasse St exit, go down the corridor and up the escalator, go straight past the Nordsee restaurant, and look for a doorway that says NH Hoteles, open the door and go down a bit in the alley/driveway to the front lobby). You can get to the downtown core by subway in 5 minutes and walking by about 20 minutes.
reviews.title: Excellent choice-Value for money

likes.disliked: — some advices from the front desk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was probably one of the best hotel I have ever stayed. Room was really huge, very well furnished, modern, clean and newly renovated. Wifi worked without a shot. Excellent and helpfull staff. Great location - undeground is just outside of the hotel! It is really worth of its 4 stars and its price. Room was cleaned up very precisely.
reviews.title: Great modern hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 3 nights in April 2010. Previous guests/ reviewers had reported noise due to building works nearby - we did not experience any noise during our stay. Good location for bars and restaurants and the staff were extremely helpful (particularly Katarina).
reviews.title: Great for a short trip to Vienna

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010
reviews.text: Just wonderful! I would definately stay there again because: It was spotless clean, my son and I were given a two rooms apartment, superb beds, it was sophisticated decorated and very quiet. In the morning breakfast was tasty and we could choose from a wide variety of cakes, cereals, coffee, dairy products etc. But above all, it was the staff that made the difference: Helpful, kind and very professional. A really good choice!
reviews.title: A gem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a pleasant stay for us with both the hotel and staff being lovely. Vienna is such a beautiful city and this hotel is in a good location with a metro stop on the door step, a shopping street out the front of the hotel and the museum quarter a 5 min walk away.
reviews.title: Well appointed hotel in a good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were in the NH style with wooden floors.
reviews.title: Comfortable stay in central location with helpful advice and good service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We just returned from a 10 day Prague/Vienna trip and booked rooms for 3 nights at the NH Wien for our group of 6 adults and 2 young children. The accomodations were great for us because of the convenience of having a small kitchen with refrigerator/microwave, and separate bedroom/living room suite, so we could put the children to sleep and still hang out in the living room area.
reviews.title: Great suite for children

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: The location is also very convenient, most sightseeing is within 10-15 min walk, and there were lots of restaurants/cafes/shopping on MariaHilfer Strausse as well. We are from Chicago, so I would equate it to a mini-Michigan Ave type location (we even spent our last day in Vienna shopping!) And if you just head a few streets north of MariaHilfer, you are in the Neubeagausse neighborhood that has a very local feel to it as well.
reviews.title: Good hotel but not perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: While the hotel itself lacks character, it worked out great for our needs.
reviews.title: Great place to stay with family!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here for one week on business. Clean spacious room, breakfast was excellent with a superb varied selection of foods and pastries. Courteous and helpfull staff, and everything was clean and well maintained.
reviews.title: Fantastic city location and extremely high value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: However this hotel is supposed to cater for international travellers, so why have I got an old fashioned TV in my room that only shows channels in German and Turkish apart from CNN and a BBC entertainment channel. If you want to attract more international guests then at least get cable or satellite TV so that there is a choice of TV in different languages and not just German.
reviews.title: Good hotel in a good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Stayed there for four nights last week. Spacious suite, included living room + bed room + kitchenette. Very clean, friendly stuff, reasonable maintenance. Outrageous price for in room wi-fi (11 Euro per day. Free in the lobby though). Excellent location on Mariahilfer St., 1 minute walk to the subway, 15-20 minuets walk downtown (Stephansdom), very comfortable to reach all the major attractions. The buffet breakfast was the highlight of the stay. Unless the construction works and the noisy drillings at 7:12AM, it could have been a very nice stay.
reviews.title: They should have told us about the construction works

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited Vienna in January. Although it was enough cold, because of the instant walking we did not feel it so much. Sometimes, it was snowing making a perfect atmosphere. Vienna is a huge museum. Everywhere you turn and have a look, you will sure see something admirable. Our hotel in modern design had excellent service. The breakfast has more than enormous. The room was everyday clean. It had so much space. It was a kind of a small suite, I could say. Reception helped us keeping our buggages more hours after checkout on the lobby, because of our late flight. Thanks.
reviews.title: Vienna in white, perfect staying location, perfect service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All though it was at first a bit tricky to locate it was one of the best hotels I've stayed in. The staff were extremely helpful in both helping us select modes of transport eg. trains trams etc and what to see plus general information. The rooms were large compared to most European hotels, the breakfast was very nice. Not a bad hotel at all.
reviews.title: Staff fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for five nights. Great value hotel, big rooms, good location, incredible staff, great breakfast.I highly recommend it, since it meets all requirements for a pleasant stay in a big city.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night. Everything was ok, only one thing I had a comment. Although our room was no smoking, at the elevators we very often felt the cigarette smoke because all smokers smoke in front of the hotel/at the yard. Otherwise everything ok, hotel garage for 18 Euro/day and breakfast very good.
reviews.title: Met our needs for shopping area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spend five nights here during two recent visits, and the hotel fully met our needs. While the atmosphere is that of a business class hotel, and does lack quaintness and charm; a great location with reasonable rates, clean spacious rooms, and an energized attentive staff made this a most pleasant stay. The hotel is located at the Neubaugasse station on the U3 metro (exit the station at the “Stiftgasse” stairway and follow the hallway away from the street leading outside to a courtyard and the hotel entrance). The Hofburg Palace and other major tourist sites are located about a comfortable 20 minute walk from the hotel, or you can take the metro. There’s a great cafeteria style seafood restaurant (Nordsee) right by the Stiftgasse metro exit and several other restaurants nearby, including a McDonalds for breakfast if you don’t want to spend a fortune at the hotel. There’s also a large supermarket a few hundred feet from the hotel. My only complaint (and it’s a nit) is that the rooms are quite dark at night, due to limited lighting. My experience is that this is not uncommon for European hotels. Bottom line, I’d stay here again in a heartbeat!
reviews.title: Fully Met our Needs

likes.disliked: — Rooms are a bit dark at night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights at the NH Wien in September 2008. By arrival, we were given a suite which was absolutely spacious and nicely decorated in the 4th floor. The suite consisted of a living room with sofa, desk, bar and small kitchenette (microwave, fridge, kettle with tea and coffee, cutlery was obtainable at the reception). We enjoyed the room a lot, the only problem was, that neither the ac functioned, nor could we use the blinds, as they were broken --> so the room got really hot after having a temperature of 30C....
reviews.title: Great Location & nice Suites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: There is a garage owned by the hotel which was practical as we arrived by car - the cost of 17 Euros per day is quite high though. The staff was very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Great for an overnight stay to catch a plane

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is excellent - it's only a 10 minute walk to the Ring (Kunsthistorisches Museum, Naturhistorisches Museum) and a 15 minute walk to the Hofburg. I would like to put something right though which wasn't pointed out correctly in other reviews: If you want to use public transport to get to the city centre, then you don't have to buy 2 but ONLY 1 ticket to get to Stephansplatz for instance (1,70 EURO). It is only a 3 stop ride away with the U3, the stop of the NH being called "Neubaugasse". So it is absolutely easy and fast to use public transport/subways from this hotel and not at all complicated as written in other reviews!
reviews.title: Never again! One of the worst travel experiences

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: I stayed here one night to be close to the airport for an early morning flight. The hotel is just across the taxi stand on the arrivals level. It is perfect if you don't want to deal with the stress of getting up early, worrying whether the taxi will come on time, worrying about whether there will be a lot of traffic, etc.. At the NH, you're already there.
reviews.title: Great location/hotel...but don't buy breakfast :-)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: When I read other reviews about this hotel, I didn't believe what they said, that the rooms were suites. But my room was a spacious suite, one of the renovated ones. I asked at reception and this is the standard room. The NH Wien is a suite-hotel (So is the NH Atterseehaus down the street). The room was more or less as you see in the photos. Nice, modern decor, with a microwave, refrigerator, breakfast bar, sitting room with leather couch and work desk, separate bedroom, spacious bathroom with a tub. The bed is quite comfortable. The floors are wood veneer. There is an electronic safe and wireless (only) internet. The people at reception were friendly and helpful. There is no free wireless in the rooms. You can buy a 500Mb 24-hour plan for 11 euros or unlimited Mb 24 hour plan for 18 euros. That’s really not so bad. The computer in the lobby has free access and a free laser printer, however.
reviews.title: Great value and a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: I have just a few minor niggles. The aircon (this is mid July, hot & humid) works well, but the markings on the control unit are a mystery. You don't know which slider is for the heat and which is for the cooling. So, I turned them both to ON, just set the temp, and it turned out fine. The room, while contemporary and comfortable is rather bare. It could do with a bit of decoration on the walls. The bedroom would benefit from one good strong floor lamp. A chair in the bedroom, and small coffee table in the sitting room, as per the other travelers’ photos, would be welcome. The TV stand needs rollers. I pushed my TV from the bedroom to the sitting room, and I can see how it might be rather awkward without rollers for some people, plus it could scratch the floor. The granite breakfast bar comes to rather a sharp point. I was slightly concerned about impaling myself on it. Clearly a design flaw. The end definitely needs to be angled off in the reverse direction. Throw in a couple of area rugs or small carpets, and I'd think I was at home. Sometimes the reception has only one person who can get a bit overwhelmed.
reviews.title: Perfect location, great hotel!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While the hotel's address is Mariahilferstrasse, it is actually set back from that main street and more easily entered from Lindengasse, the parallel street behind. My accomodation was in the wing on Lindengasse, facing the Mariahilferstrasse wing, so quite peaceful. I don't know how the other wing is for noise. The rooms are pretty well sound-insulated, I think, for a multi-residence building. If you need to have a view, this hotel doesn’t have any.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel - highly recommended (great location, very clean, great value for money)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Mariahilferstrasse is a main shopping street with plenty of activity, restaurants, cafes, a gym across the street, 10 minutes walk to the Museum Quartier in one direction and 10 minutes walk to the Westbanhof in the other direction. The hotel is atop the U3 subway, so, given Vienna’s excellent transit system, the location couldn't get any better.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel, stay here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: I would definitely stay here again. I had friends staying at the Meridian, and though plush, pricey, trendy, and dripping with services, I think the NH Wien is better because it is in a livelier area, and my suite was bigger and cheaper than their room. In fact, my friends told me they would have chosen the NH Wien if they'd known about it :-)
reviews.title: Classy NH Hotel

likes.disliked: — Entrance difficult to find, especially at night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived at the Vienna airport and the taxis are plentiful costing 42 euros and took about 30minutes and we were off to a great start to our holiday. We had no problem finding the hotel as the driver knew exactly where it was and we drove up Lindengasse and he stopped right at the hotel door and unloaded the luggage.
reviews.title: FANTASTIC LOCATION

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The receptionist was most accommodating and we were checked in very quickly.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: There was a large living room/kitchen with fridge and microwave. Nice bathroom with bath and showerand wash-hand basin. Bedroom with wardrobe and two large single beds with duvets and lovely crisp white linen throughout. The beds were extremely comfortable.
reviews.title: Great value for big rooms
